name: Real-world surface area from nets and volume of right rectangular prisms

skills.name: Calculate the surface area of a cuboid where the dimensions are given in the same units
Calculate the surface area of a triangular based prism where the dimensions are given in the same units
Calculate the volume of a cuboid when the dimensions are given in the same units
Calculate the surface area of a pyramid (no pythagoras)

explanations.A: You are almost there, you just need to add on the areas of the top and bottom of the box.
explanations.B: The area of the top and bottom is 3 x 9 = 27. The sides are 36 each, and the front and back are 108 each. 108 + 108 + 27 + 27 + 9 + 9 = 288.
explanations.C: I think you have found the volume rather than the surface area. Remember to find the area of each part of the net, and then add them all together.
explanations.D: I think you have found the area of one of each sized face. Remember there are two faces of each side on a cuboid.

explanations.A: I think you have found the volume rather than the surface area. Remember to find the area of each part of the net, and then add them all together.
explanations.B: I think you have found the area of one of each sized face. Remember there are two faces of each side on a cuboid.
explanations.C: You are almost there, you just need to add on the areas of the top and bottom of the box.
explanations.D: The area of the top and bottom is 2 x 7 = 14. The sides are 20 each, and the front and back are 70 each.70 + 70 + 20 + 20 + 14 + 14 = 208.

explanations.A: I think you have found the area of all the rectangles, but don't forget the two triangular sides need to be waterproofed too.
explanations.B: Almost, but remember the area of a triangle is base x height / 2. I think you forgot to do the division for the triangles.
explanations.C: The area of the rectangles are 5 x 8, 6 x 8 and 5 x 8. This is 40, 48 and 40 respectively. For the triangles we have 6 x 4 /2 = 12. In total we have 40 + 48 + 40 + 12 + 12 = 152 square foot.
explanations.D: Almost, just check your units. We are finding surface area, not volume.

explanations.A: Almost, but remember the area of a triangle is base x height / 2. I think you forgot to do the division for the triangles.
explanations.B: The area of the rectangles are 10 x 15, 12 x 15 and 10 x 15. This is 150, 180 and 150 respectively. For the triangles we have 12 x 8 /2 = 48. In total we have 150 + 180 + 150 + 48 + 48 = 576 square foot.
explanations.C: Almost, just check your units. We are finding surface area, not volume.
explanations.D: I think you have found the area of all the rectangles, but don't forget the two triangular sides need to be waterproofed too.

explanations.A: I think you have tried to find the volume of the pyramid. We need the surface area, which is the area of all the faces.
explanations.B: I think you have found the area of all the triangles, but remember you need the area of the square too.
explanations.C: Almost, but remember the area of a triangle is base x height / 2. I think you forgot to do the division for the triangles.
explanations.D: The area of the square is 6 x 6 = 36. Each of the triangles is 6 x 5 / 2 = 15. In total we have four triangles, so 4 lots of 15, and the 36 which is 96.

explanations.A: I think you have found the area of all the triangles, but remember you need the area of the square too.
explanations.B: The area of the square is 8 x 8 = 64. Each of the triangles is 6 x 8 / 2 = 24. In total we have four triangles, so 4 lots of 24, and the 64 which is 160.
explanations.C: I think you have tried to find the volume of the pyramid. We need the surface area, which is the area of all the faces.
explanations.D: Almost, but remember the area of a triangle is base x height / 2. I think you forgot to do the division for the triangles.

explanations.A: I think that you used the wrong dimension for the area of the triangle. Remember it is the base and perpendicular height that you use, not the sloped height.
explanations.B: The area of the rectangles are 14 x 5 = 70, 14 x 12 = 168, 14 x 13 = 178. The triangles are each 5 x 12 / 2 = 30. In total we have 70 + 168 + 182 + 30 + 30 = 480 square cm.
explanations.C: Almost, but remember the area of a triangle is base x height / 2. I think you forgot to do the division for the triangles.
explanations.D: I think you have found the volume rather than the surface area. Remember to find the area of each part of the net, and then add them all together.

explanations.A: Almost, but remember the area of a triangle is base x height / 2. I think you forgot to do the division for the triangles.
explanations.B: I think you have found the volume rather than the surface area. Remember to find the area of each part of the net, and then add them all together.
explanations.C: I think that you used the wrong dimension for the area of the triangle. Remember it is the base and perpendicular height that you use, not the sloped height.
explanations.D: The area of the rectangles are 16 x 8 = 128, 16 x 15 = 240, 16 x 17 = 272. The triangles are each 8 x 15 / 2 = 60. In total we have 128 + 240 + 272 + 60 + 60 square cm.

explanations.A: The volume of a right rectangular prism is base area x height. 7 1/2 x 1/2 = 3 3/4 cubic cm.
explanations.B: I think you have tried to break down the multiplication, but made a mistake when multiplying 7 by 1/2. Try writing your numbers as improper fractions before doing the multiplication.
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied the mixed fraction incorrectly, treating the 7 like a numerator. Try writing the mixed number as an improper fraction before doing the multiplication.
explanations.D: I think you have squared the 7 1/2. Remember the volume of a prism is base area x height.

explanations.A: I think you have tried to break down the multiplication, but made a mistake when multiplying 5 by 1/2. Try writing your numbers as improper fractions before doing the multiplication.
explanations.B: I think you have squared the 5 1/2. Remember the volume of a prism is base area x height.
explanations.C: The volume of a right rectangular prism is base area x height. 5 1/2 x 1/2 = 2 3/4 cubic cm.
explanations.D: I think you have multiplied the mixed fraction incorrectly, treating the 5 like a numerator. Try writing the mixed number as an improper fraction before doing the multiplication.
